lines.text: Enter GLOUCESTER, and EDGAR dressed like a peasant

lines.speaker: gloucester
lines.text: When shall we come to the top of that same hill

lines.speaker: edgar
lines.text: You do climb up it now: look, how we labour.

lines.speaker: gloucester
lines.text: Methinks the ground is even.

lines.speaker: edgar
lines.text: Horrible steep. Hark, do you hear the sea

lines.speaker: gloucester
lines.text: No, truly.

lines.speaker: edgar
lines.text: Why, then, your other senses grow imperfect By your eyes anguish.

lines.speaker: gloucester
lines.text: So may it be, indeed: Methinks thy voice is alterd and thou speakst In better phrase and matter than thou didst.

lines.speaker: edgar
lines.text: Youre much deceived: in nothing am I changed But in my garments.

lines.speaker: gloucester
lines.text: Methinks youre better spoken.

lines.speaker: edgar
lines.text: Come on, sir heres the place: stand still. How fearful And dizzy tis, to cast ones eyes so low! The crows and choughs that wing the midway air Show scarce so gross as beetles: half way down Hangs one that gathers samphire, dreadful trade! Methinks he seems no bigger than his head: The fishermen, that walk upon the beach, Appear like mice and yond tall anchoring bark, Diminishd to her cock her cock, a buoy Almost too small for sight: the murmuring surge, That on the unnumberd idle pebbles chafes, Cannot be heard so high. Ill look no more Lest my brain turn, and the deficient sight Topple down headlong.

lines.speaker: gloucester
lines.text: Set me where you stand.

lines.speaker: edgar
lines.text: Give me your hand: you are now within a foot Of the extreme verge: for all beneath the moon Would I not leap upright.

lines.speaker: gloucester
lines.text: Let go my hand. Here, friend, s another purse in it a jewel Well worth a poor mans taking: fairies and gods Prosper it with thee! Go thou farther off Bid me farewell, and let me hear thee going.

lines.speaker: edgar
lines.text: Now fare you well, good sir.

lines.speaker: gloucester
lines.text: With all my heart.

lines.speaker: edgar
lines.text: Why I do trifle thus with his despair Is done to cure it.

lines.speaker: gloucester
lines.text: [Kneeling]  O you mighty gods! This world I do renounce, and, in your sights, Shake patiently my great affliction off: If I could bear it longer, and not fall To quarrel with your great opposeless wills, My snuff and loathed part of nature should Burn itself out. If Edgar live, O, bless him! Now, fellow, fare thee well.
He falls forward

lines.speaker: edgar
lines.text: Gone, sir: farewell. And yet I know not how conceit may rob The treasury of life, when life itself Yields to the theft: had he been where he thought, By this, had thought been past. Alive or dead Ho, you sir! friend! Hear you, sir! speak! Thus might he pass indeed: yet he revives. What are you, sir

lines.speaker: gloucester
lines.text: Away, and let me die.

lines.speaker: edgar
lines.text: Hadst thou been aught but gossamer, feathers, air, So many fathom down precipitating, Thoudst shiverd like an egg: but thou dost breathe Hast heavy substance bleedst not speakst art sound. Ten masts at each make not the altitude Which thou hast perpendicularly fell: Thy lifes a miracle. Speak yet again.

lines.speaker: gloucester
lines.text: But have I falln, or no

lines.speaker: edgar
lines.text: From the dread summit of this chalky bourn. Look up aheight the shrillgorged lark so far Cannot be seen or heard: do but look up.

lines.speaker: gloucester
lines.text: Alack, I have no eyes. Is wretchedness deprived that benefit, To end itself by death Twas yet some comfort, When misery could beguile the tyrants rage, And frustrate his proud will.

lines.speaker: edgar
lines.text: Give me your arm: Up: so. How is t Feel you your legs You stand.

lines.speaker: gloucester
lines.text: Too well, too well.

lines.speaker: edgar
lines.text: This is above all strangeness. Upon the crown o the cliff, what thing was that Which parted from you

lines.speaker: gloucester
lines.text: A poor unfortunate beggar.

lines.speaker: edgar
lines.text: As I stood here below, methought his eyes Were two full moons he had a thousand noses, Horns whelkd and waved like the enridged sea: It was some fiend therefore, thou happy father, Think that the clearest gods, who make them honours Of mens impossibilities, have preserved thee.

lines.speaker: gloucester
lines.text: I do remember now: henceforth Ill bear Affliction till it do cry out itself Enough, enough, and die. That thing you speak of, I took it for a man often twould say The fiend, the fiend: he led me to that place.

lines.speaker: edgar
lines.text: Bear free and patient thoughts. But who comes here The safer sense will neer accommodate His master thus.
Enter KING LEAR, fantastically dressed with wild flowers

lines.speaker: king lear
lines.text: No, they cannot touch me for coining I am the king himself.

lines.speaker: edgar
lines.text: O thou sidepiercing sight!

lines.speaker: king lear
lines.text: Natures above art in that respect. Theres your pressmoney. That fellow handles his bow like a crowkeeper: draw me a clothiers yard. Look, look, a mouse! Peace, peace this piece of toasted cheese will do t. Theres my gauntlet Ill prove it on a giant. Bring up the brown bills. O, well flown, bird! i the clout, i the clout: hewgh! Give the word.

lines.speaker: edgar
lines.text: Sweet marjoram.

lines.speaker: king lear
lines.text: Pass.

lines.speaker: gloucester
lines.text: I know that voice.

lines.speaker: king lear
lines.text: Ha! Goneril, with a white beard! They flattered me like a dog and told me I had white hairs in my beard ere the black ones were there. To say ay and no to every thing that I said!Ay and no too was no good divinity. When the rain came to wet me once, and the wind to make me chatter when the thunder would not peace at my bidding there I found em, there I smelt em out. Go to, they are not men o their words: they told me I was every thing tis a lie, I am not agueproof.

lines.speaker: gloucester
lines.text: The trick of that voice I do well remember: Is t not the king

lines.speaker: king lear
lines.text: Ay, every inch a king: When I do stare, see how the subject quakes. I pardon that mans life. What was thy cause Adultery Thou shalt not die: die for adultery! No: The wren goes to t, and the small gilded fly Does lecher in my sight. Let copulation thrive for Gloucesters bastard son Was kinder to his father than my daughters Got tween the lawful sheets. To t, luxury, pellmell! for I lack soldiers. Behold yond simpering dame, Whose face between her forks presages snow That minces virtue, and does shake the head To hear of pleasures name The fitchew, nor the soiled horse, goes to t With a more riotous appetite. Down from the waist they are Centaurs, Though women all above: But to the girdle do the gods inherit, Beneath is all the fiends Theres hell, theres darkness, theres the sulphurous pit, Burning, scalding, stench, consumption fie, fie, fie! pah, pah! Give me an ounce of civet, good apothecary, to sweeten my imagination: theres money for thee.

lines.speaker: gloucester
lines.text: O, let me kiss that hand!

lines.speaker: king lear
lines.text: Let me wipe it first it smells of mortality.

lines.speaker: gloucester
lines.text: O ruind piece of nature! This great world Shall so wear out to nought. Dost thou know me

lines.speaker: king lear
lines.text: I remember thine eyes well enough. Dost thou squiny at me No, do thy worst, blind Cupid! Ill not love. Read thou this challenge mark but the penning of it.

lines.speaker: gloucester
lines.text: Were all the letters suns, I could not see one.

lines.speaker: edgar
lines.text: I would not take this from report it is, And my heart breaks at it.

lines.speaker: king lear
lines.text: Read.

lines.speaker: gloucester
lines.text: What, with the case of eyes

lines.speaker: king lear
lines.text: O, ho, are you there with me No eyes in your head, nor no money in your purse Your eyes are in a heavy case, your purse in a light yet you see how this world goes.

lines.speaker: gloucester
lines.text: I see it feelingly.

lines.speaker: king lear
lines.text: What, art mad A man may see how this world goes with no eyes. Look with thine ears: see how yond justice rails upon yond simple thief. Hark, in thine ear: change places and, handydandy, which is the justice, which is the thief Thou hast seen a farmers dog bark at a beggar

lines.speaker: gloucester
lines.text: Ay, sir.

lines.speaker: king lear
lines.text: And the creature run from the cur There thou mightst behold the great image of authority: a dogs obeyed in office. Thou rascal beadle, hold thy bloody hand! Why dost thou lash that whore Strip thine own back Thou hotly lustst to use her in that kind For which thou whippst her. The usurer hangs the cozener. Through tatterd clothes small vices do appear Robes and furrd gowns hide all. Plate sin with gold, And the strong lance of justice hurtless breaks: Arm it in rags, a pigmys straw does pierce it. None does offend, none, I say, none Ill able em: Take that of me, my friend, who have the power To seal the accusers lips. Get thee glass eyes And like a scurvy politician, seem To see the things thou dost not. Now, now, now, now: Pull off my boots: harder, harder: so.

lines.speaker: edgar
lines.text: O, matter and impertinency mixd! Reason in madness!

lines.speaker: king lear
lines.text: If thou wilt weep my fortunes, take my eyes. I know thee well enough thy name is Gloucester: Thou must be patient we came crying hither: Thou knowst, the first time that we smell the air, We wawl and cry. I will preach to thee: mark.

lines.speaker: gloucester
lines.text: Alack, alack the day!

lines.speaker: king lear
lines.text: When we are born, we cry that we are come To this great stage of fools: this a good block It were a delicate stratagem, to shoe A troop of horse with felt: Ill put t in proof And when I have stoln upon these sonsinlaw, Then, kill, kill, kill, kill, kill, kill!
Enter a Gentleman, with Attendants

lines.speaker: gentleman
lines.text: O, here he is: lay hand upon him. Sir, Your most dear daughter

lines.speaker: king lear
lines.text: No rescue What, a prisoner I am even The natural fool of fortune. Use me well You shall have ransom. Let me have surgeons I am cut to the brains.

lines.speaker: gentleman
lines.text: You shall have any thing.

lines.speaker: king lear
lines.text: No seconds all myself Why, this would make a man a man of salt, To use his eyes for garden waterpots, Ay, and laying autumns dust.

lines.speaker: gentleman
lines.text: Good sir,

lines.speaker: king lear
lines.text: I will die bravely, like a bridegroom. What! I will be jovial: come, come I am a king, My masters, know you that.

lines.speaker: gentleman
lines.text: You are a royal one, and we obey you.

lines.speaker: king lear
lines.text: Then theres life int. Nay, if you get it, you shall get it with running. Sa, sa, sa, sa. Exit running Attendants follow

lines.speaker: gentleman
lines.text: A sight most pitiful in the meanest wretch, Past speaking of in a king! Thou hast one daughter, Who redeems nature from the general curse Which twain have brought her to.

lines.speaker: edgar
lines.text: Hail, gentle sir.

lines.speaker: gentleman
lines.text: Sir, speed you: whats your will

lines.speaker: edgar
lines.text: Do you hear aught, sir, of a battle toward

lines.speaker: gentleman
lines.text: Most sure and vulgar: every one hears that, Which can distinguish sound.

lines.speaker: edgar
lines.text: But, by your favour, How nears the other army

lines.speaker: gentleman
lines.text: Near and on speedy foot the main descry Stands on the hourly thought.

lines.speaker: edgar
lines.text: I thank you, sir: thats all.

lines.speaker: gentleman
lines.text: Though that the queen on special cause is here, Her army is moved on.

lines.speaker: edgar
lines.text: I thank you, sir.
Exit Gentleman

lines.speaker: gloucester
lines.text: You evergentle gods, take my breath from me: Let not my worser spirit tempt me again To die before you please!

lines.speaker: edgar
lines.text: Well pray you, father.

lines.speaker: gloucester
lines.text: Now, good sir, what are you

lines.speaker: edgar
lines.text: A most poor man, made tame to fortunes blows Who, by the art of known and feeling sorrows, Am pregnant to good pity. Give me your hand, Ill lead you to some biding.

lines.speaker: gloucester
lines.text: Hearty thanks: The bounty and the benison of heaven To boot, and boot!
Enter OSWALD

lines.speaker: oswald
lines.text: A proclaimd prize! Most happy! That eyeless head of thine was first framed flesh To raise my fortunes. Thou old unhappy traitor, Briefly thyself remember: the sword is out That must destroy thee.

lines.speaker: gloucester
lines.text: Now let thy friendly hand Put strength enough tot.
EDGAR interposes

lines.speaker: oswald
lines.text: Wherefore, bold peasant, Darest thou support a publishd traitor Hence Lest that the infection of his fortune take Like hold on thee. Let go his arm.

lines.speaker: edgar
lines.text: Chill not let go, zir, without vurther casion.

lines.speaker: oswald
lines.text: Let go, slave, or thou diest!

lines.speaker: edgar
lines.text: Good gentleman, go your gait, and let poor volk pass. An chud ha bin zwaggered out of my life, twould not ha bin zo long as tis by a vortnight. Nay, come not near th old man keep out, che vor ye, or ise try whether your costard or my ballow be the harder: chill be plain with you.

lines.speaker: oswald
lines.text: Out, dunghill!

lines.speaker: edgar
lines.text: Chill pick your teeth, zir: come no matter vor your foins.
They fight, and EDGAR knocks him down

lines.speaker: oswald
lines.text: Slave, thou hast slain me: villain, take my purse: If ever thou wilt thrive, bury my body And give the letters which thou findst about me To Edmund earl of Gloucester seek him out Upon the British party: O, untimely death!
Dies

lines.speaker: edgar
lines.text: I know thee well: a serviceable villain As duteous to the vices of thy mistress As badness would desire.

lines.speaker: gloucester
lines.text: What, is he dead

lines.speaker: edgar
lines.text: Sit you down, father rest you Lets see these pockets: the letters that he speaks of May be my friends. Hes dead I am only sorry He had no other deathsman. Let us see: Leave, gentle wax and, manners, blame us not: To know our enemies minds, weld rip their hearts Their papers, is more lawful. Let our reciprocal vows be remembered. You have many opportunities to cut him off: if your will want not, time and place will be fruitfully offered. There is nothing done, if he return the conqueror: then am I the prisoner, and his bed my goal from the loathed warmth whereof deliver me, and supply the place for your labour. Yourwife, so I would say Affectionate servant, GONERIL. O undistinguishd space of womans will! A plot upon her virtuous husbands life And the exchange my brother! Here, in the sands, Thee Ill rake up, the post unsanctified Of murderous lechers: and in the mature time With this ungracious paper strike the sight Of the death practised duke: for him tis well That of thy death and business I can tell.
Reads

lines.speaker: gloucester
lines.text: The king is mad: how stiff is my vile sense, That I stand up, and have ingenious feeling Of my huge sorrows! Better I were distract: So should my thoughts be severd from my griefs, And woes by wrong imaginations lose The knowledge of themselves.

lines.speaker: edgar
lines.text: Give me your hand: Far off, methinks, I hear the beaten drum: Come, father, Ill bestow you with a friend. soft music playing Gentleman, and others attending.
Drum afar off
Exeunt
